title: Total amount of water drained from a tank

content.question: A spherical tank contains 81.637 gallons of water at time t = 0 minutes. For the next 6 minutes, water flows out of the tank at the rate of <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mn>9</mn><mi>sin</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo> <mrow> <msqrt> <mrow> <mi>t</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow> </msqrt> </mrow> <mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaaeaaaaaaaaa8 qacaaI5aGaci4CaiaacMgacaGGUbWaaeWaa8aabaWdbmaakaaapaqa a8qacaWG0bGaey4kaSIaaGymaaWcbeaaaOGaayjkaiaawMcaaaaa@3E33@ </annotation> </semantics> </math> gallons per minute. How many gallons of water are in the tank at the end of the 6 minutes?

topic.text: 8.3: Using Accumulation Functions and Definite Integrals in Applied Contexts

skill.text: Skill 3.D: Apply an appropriate mathematical definition, theorem, or test.
